commit_message:
Add Hitachi HSP driver

This patch adds the Hitachi HSP driver.

Co-Authored-By: Marcus V R Nascimento <marcusvrn@gmail.com>

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint hsp-driver
Change-Id: Ie3028cbff56873721dc51ff4d7fccf7fb7e99611

commit_message:
Correct floating IP updating with same port_id issue

If user try to update floating IP with port_id that it associated
with, the neutron API will return a bad request exception.

This patch adds a check for the updating API to determine whether
the association is changed.

Change-Id: I620b085238cb27dcef9989a27ba14cd2e3f5f07c
Closes-Bug: #1578523

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects.
In the Openstack style guidelines they recommend to import only modules.

Change-Id: I5204534e10b86584bdf4419fba4655033e6efc28

commit_message:
Added SNI support for os_sahara role via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I3c66e5468b07404b24f2eed6cd199f603730b631

commit_message:
Fix test_shelve_volume_backed_instance

test_shelve_volume_backed_instance actually created an instance with the
volume attached as a data disk rather than the root disk. This fix makes
it create an instance with the volume as the root disk.

Change-Id: I719aa7ec2507b7936c08d17108511260830ad099
Closes-Bug: 1613946

deleted_lines: if boot_from_volume: volume = self.create_volume(size=CONF.volume.volume_size, imageRef=CONF.compute.image_ref) bd_map = [{ 'device_name': 'vda', 'volume_id': volume['id'], 'delete_on_termination': '0'}] server = self.create_server( key_name=keypair['name'], security_groups=security_groups, block_device_mapping=bd_map, wait_until='ACTIVE') else: server = self.create_server( image_id=CONF.compute.image_ref, key_name=keypair['name'], security_groups=security_groups, wait_until='ACTIVE')

commit_message:
Added SNI support for ansible_plugins via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I80355c8a82a0a0b295672c97c0740809659405b1

commit_message:
SoftwareComponent hierarchy refactoring

Introduced a number of changes to classes of SoftwareComponent
hierarchy:

* BaseSoftwareComponent class removed, Installable and Configurable have
  no base anymore.

* Allowed number of failures may now be configured independently for
  different workflows.

* Allowed number of failures extended with 'two' and 'three'.

* Attribute usage for state persistence is simplified: attributes are
  now saved on appropriate servers and server groups.

* Inverted the names and semantics of status checking methods: they now
  return true if the needed status is already applied and no further
  action is needed.

* on%something% methods no longer trigger events, they have no default
  bodies at all, so it's easier to override them; events are triggered
  by the caller method.

* Handler methods got more arguments: besides the primary argument (a
  servergroup or a server) they get a list of pending servers, failed
  servers et.

* Some methods and method arguments renamed for consistency.

Change-Id: Ic52e66014d18e7fe640b79dd161286a1a9ebe15e

commit_message:
WIP Handle urllib3.exceptions.MaxRetryError

After review[1], it seems urllib3 is throwing
MaxRetryError with embeded ReadTimeoutError after
the number of retry attempts are exceeded.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294425/

Change-Id: I3ea530ed924857e73abf4a437bd0099c98f56fb9
Closes-Bug: #1614078

commit_message:
Use skip_checks in test_floating_ips_admins_actions

In FloatingIPAdminTestJSON, specifying floating IP address feature
is necessary, it is the same to add test cases in the future, so
use skip_checks instead of skipUnless.

Change-Id: I359778661509d95da3e1349f372600ae574e1782
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/355292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(FloatingIPAdminTestJSON,cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.neutron_plugin_options.specify_floating_ip_address_available: raise cls.skipException("Feature for specifying floating IP address is disabled.")
deleted_lines: import testtools @testtools.skipUnless( CONF.neutron_plugin_options.specify_floating_ip_address_available, "Feature for specifying floating IP address is disabled")

commit_message:
Hierarchy removed from level values

We don't need to have duplicate of levels hierarchy in the
level values. Without duplication we can easy change hierarchy
levels in the environment.
Cascade deletion added on level deletion to level values.

Change-Id: I9aded18c93b8c3f0f08e59817d33e7d21ff12d54

commit_message:
Reconnect to auth url in case of ClientProtocolException

We had a case where the authorization VIP was reset after the
monasca-api started.  The auth connection pool did not try to
reconnect since we did not meet the configured idle time, and
we had to restart the monasca-api.  This fix will allow the
monasca-api to reconnect the auth pool connections when we
get an exception.

Change-Id: I7e45970360720193b2d0ba27964bc22f66db79d3

commit_message:
remove overcloud roles from oooq

Replace the native overcloud role with an *exact* duplicate that is
now in http://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-role-quickstart-overcloud

The ansible-role-tripleo-overcloud needs to be fixed to work with the
native quickstart undercloud role. To facilitate the immediate removal
of the overcloud role from quickstart.

Implements: blueprint Replace instack-virt-setup with a new tool
(tripleo-quickstart)

Change-Id: Ifcc085a16de2158e13c3eb5e52249bd46ee8eb92

commit_message:
Return None in get_instance_id_by_floating_address

_show_port() can raise a PortNotFound exception, but the method
get_instance_id_by_floating_address() doesn't handle it. On the
other hand, the method returns None if fip doesn't contain
port_id as a normal case.
On the caller side, "Delete a floating ip" API can use the returned
value None to disassociate_and_release_floating_ip() and the method
handles the None as a normal value.

So this patch makes get_instance_id_by_floating_address return None
if PortNotFound happens.

Closes-Bug: #1586931

Change-Id: I03be8100155d343eb6a4ea9eda3f1498ad3fb4cf

commit_message:
Fixed neutron-db-manage without neutron/tests installed

With 7c0f189309789ebcbd5c20c5a86835576ffb5db3 in tree, we made
neutron-db-manage require neutron/tests/tools.py installed. Some
distributions, like RDO, may split the python package into core package
and the one that contains python code needed for testing only (anything
under neutron/tests/), and hence don't guarantee that all setups have
neutron.tests package available.

This fix moves the import_module_recursively function from
neutron.tests.tools into neutron.common.utils because it has non-testing
use cases. All existing cases where we use the function switched to the
new location. The old symbol still works, though triggers a deprecation
warning, and will be removed in the next cycle.

Change-Id: Ia8d91a1704c894bc1f6cf14e6cdd971fab255b62
Closes-Bug: #1612959

commit_message:
Check the router gateway IPs prefixlen existence

When we remove the router gateway, if it has multiple IPs
for the gateway port, the router remove procedure will not
work properly and will cause a router remove infinite loop.
This is because the neutron server only gives the first (lowest)
gateway IP a 'prefixlen', and not the secondary IPs, so
the router remove will get a KeyError.

This patch adds a `prefixlen` check before removing the gateway IPs
conntrack state.

Change-Id: I425897578d8bd44f4e5f9dd44de9717ae4e50fcd
Closes-Bug: #1609248
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/23/351023/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add expand, data migration and contract logic to keystone-manage

3 new migration repos are added, one for each of the new phases.
The existing "migrate_repo" is now frozen (except for backports).
The sql_banned operations tests are now applied both to the
frozen legacy repo and the expand repo.

This patch contains a null first migration in each repo (some
of our support methods don't handle empty repos) - follow on
patches will add actual migration scripts to these repos.

Implements: blueprint manage-migration
Change-Id: Ie68b463b7a3acbf39486d75026b80bf5dcbc5288

subject: Add dummy domain_id column to cached role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 19:03:21.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/3a1e41fecfe9e4b7dfa8391476202c3113456c89', 'message': "Add dummy domain_id column to cached role

When token caching is turned on, upgrading from stable/liberty to
stable/mitaka or master causes tokens to fail to be issued for the
time-to-live of the cache. This is because as part of the token
issuance the token's role is looked up, and the cached version of the
role immediately after upgrade does not have a domain_id field, even
though that column was successfully added to the role database. This
patch hacks around that by artificially adding a null domain_id value
to the role reference.

This must be done in the manager, as opposed to the driver, because it
is the manager that is caching the value and so modifying the value
returned by the driver has no effect.

Change-Id: I55c791486f2a26ae995f693370b016895176a16f
Closes-bug: #1592169
(cherry picked from commit bc99dc76775d22eca01b818f37de35a76ece9d72)
"}]
commit_message:
Add dummy domain_id column to cached role

When token caching is turned on, upgrading from stable/liberty to
stable/mitaka or master causes tokens to fail to be issued for the
time-to-live of the cache. This is because as part of the token
issuance the token's role is looked up, and the cached version of the
role immediately after upgrade does not have a domain_id field, even
though that column was successfully added to the role database. This
patch hacks around that by artificially adding a null domain_id value
to the role reference.

This must be done in the manager, as opposed to the driver, because it
is the manager that is caching the value and so modifying the value
returned by the driver has no effect.

Change-Id: I55c791486f2a26ae995f693370b016895176a16f
Closes-bug: #1592169
(cherry picked from commit bc99dc76775d22eca01b818f37de35a76ece9d72)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/15/357415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools def _append_null_domain_id(f): """Append a domain_id field to a role dict if it is not already there. When caching is turned on, upgrading from liberty to mitaka or master causes tokens to fail to be issued for the time-to-live of the cache. This is because as part of the token issuance the token's role is looked up, and the cached version of the role immediately after upgrade does not have a domain_id field, even though that column was successfully added to the role database. This decorator artificially adds a null domain_id value to the role reference so that the cached value acts like the updated schema. Note: This decorator must appear before the @MEMOIZE decorator because it operates on the cached value returned by the MEMOIZE function. """ @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs): ref = f(self, *args, **kwargs) if 'domain_id' not in ref: ref['domain_id'] = None return ref return wrapper @_append_null_domain_id

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib instead of tempest-lib

tempest-lib is marked as deprecated now.
The library is not maintained and Tempest itself provides the stable
interfaces under tempest.lib as [1] said.
So this patch makes the project use tempest.lib for long-term maintenance.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tempest-lib/blob/master/README.rst#tempest-lib

Change-Id: Iede6a29411e4299469b2450c2ec8d4eac5d088ab

- It checks that person who want to trace is trusted and knows
secret HMAC key.
- It start tracing in case of proper trace headers
and add first wsgi trace point, with info about HTTP request.

* Add initialization of osprofiler at start of service
- Initialize and set an oslo.messaging based notifier instance
to osprofiler which will be used to send notifications to Ceilometer.

NOTE to test this:
1) You have to enable profiler option(s) in ironic.conf.
2) You need to enable the following services in localrc for devstack:
  CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS=notifications,profiler
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-acompute,ceilometer-acentral
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-anotification,ceilometer-collector
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-alarm-evaluator,ceilometer-alarm-notifier
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-api
3) You need to install OSprofiler:
  Enable_plugin osprofiler
3) You should use openstackclient and run ironic(baremetal) command with
  --profile <SECRET_KEY>
  $ openstack --profile <SECRET_KEY> baremetal list
  # it will print <Trace ID>
4)Get HTML with traces:
  $ osprofiler trace show --html <Trace ID>

Change-Id: I0beb20c128f695872efe187e1bfa4390a61563a3
Closes-Bug: #1560704

commit_message:
Enable support for OSprofiler in Ironic

* Add osprofiler wsgi middleware
This middleware is used for 2 things:
- It checks that person who wants to trace is trusted and knows
secret HMAC key.
- It starts tracing in case of proper trace headers
and adds first wsgi trace point, with info about HTTP request.

* Add initialization of osprofiler at start of service
- Initialize and set an oslo.messaging based notifier instance
to osprofiler, which will be used to send notifications to Ceilometer.

NOTE to test this:
1) Enable profiler option(s) in ironic.conf.
2) Enable the following services in localrc for devstack:
  CEILOMETER_NOTIFICATION_TOPICS=notifications,profiler
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-acompute,ceilometer-acentral
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-anotification,ceilometer-collector
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-alarm-evaluator,ceilometer-alarm-notifier
  ENABLED_SERVICES+=,ceilometer-api
3) Install OSprofiler:
  Enable_plugin osprofiler
3) Use openstackclient and run ironic(baremetal) command with
  --profile <SECRET_KEY>
  $ openstack --profile <SECRET_KEY> baremetal list
  # it will print <Trace ID>
4)Get HTML with traces:
  $ osprofiler trace show --html <Trace ID>

OSprofiler spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103825/

Change-Id: I0beb20c128f695872efe187e1bfa4390a61563a3
Partial-Bug: #1560704

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. Openstack style
guideline recommends to import only modules.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I54138598b2556c080b1c61753db505878a9391d0

commit_message:
Improve help text of registry client context opts

Change-Id: I5c0cbb888723a317955f0a58ff9bc619f0f6339f
Partial-Bug: #1570946
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/96/319396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help=_(""" Use user's token when talking to registry. Any component, like glance-api, image-scrubber and cache-prefetcher etc, must authenticate when talking to Glance registry (unless the registry is deployed in ``no-auth`` or ``trusted-auth`` mode). This can be done by either passing on the user token or using Glance's admin credentials. While passing on user token is probably considered best in certain situations, it may not work well when a component is not user-facing like the image-scrubber and the cache-prefetcher that work primarily as periodic tasks and across multiple user contexts. Also, since user tokens expire over a fixed window of time, they may not work well for long-running operations such as upload of big images. To overcome these, it may make sense to use admin credentials instead of user token. This configuration option indicates whether to pass-through the user token when making requests to the registry. If this is set to ``False``, admin credentials can be specified. Services which consume this: * ``glance-api`` (mandatory for v1; optional for v2) * ``image scrubber`` (a periodic task) * ``cache prefetcher`` (a periodic task) Possible values: * True * False Related options: * ``admin_user`` * ``admin_password`` * ``admin_tenant_name`` * ``auth_url`` * ``auth_strategy`` * ``auth_region`` """)), help=_(""" The administrator's user name. User name to the admin account to be used for authenticating with Glance registry. Please refer to ``use_user_token`` for more detail. Services which consume this: * ``glance-api`` (mandatory for v1; optional for v2) * ``image scrubber`` (a periodic task) * ``cache prefetcher`` (a periodic task) Possible values: * Any valid string that is a username to an admin account Related options: * ``use_user_token`` * ``admin_password`` * ``admin_tenant_name`` * ``auth_url`` * ``auth_strategy`` * ``auth_region`` """)), help=_(""" The administrator's password. Password to the admin account to be used for authenticating with Glance registry. Please refer to ``use_user_token`` for more detail. Services which consume this: * ``glance-api`` (mandatory for v1; optional for v2) * ``image scrubber`` (a periodic task) * ``cache prefetcher`` (a periodic task) Possible values: * Any valid string that is a password to an admin account Related options: * ``use_user_token`` * ``admin_user`` * ``admin_tenant_name`` * ``auth_url`` * ``auth_strategy`` * ``auth_region`` """)), help=_(""" The tenant name of the administrative user. Name of the tenant the admin account used for authenticating with Glance registry belongs to. Please refer to ``use_user_token`` for more detail. Services which consume this: * ``glance-api`` (mandatory for v1; optional for v2) * ``image scrubber`` (a periodic task) * ``cache prefetcher`` (a periodic task) Possible values: * Any valid string that is the name of tenant an admin account belongs to. Related options: * ``use_user_token`` * ``admin_user`` * ``admin_password`` * ``auth_url`` * ``auth_strategy`` * ``auth_region`` """)), help=_(""" The URL to keystone service. The URL to keystone service for authenticating with Glance registry. Please refer to ``use_user_token`` for more detail. Services which consume this: * ``glance-api`` (mandatory for v1; optional for v2) * ``image scrubber`` (a periodic task) * ``cache prefetcher`` (a periodic task) Possible values: * A valid URL that points to a keystone service. Related options: * ``use_user_token`` * ``admin_user`` * ``admin_password`` * ``admin_tenant_name`` * ``auth_strategy`` * ``auth_region`` """)), help=_(""" The strategy to use for authentication. This determines the auth strategy to be used while authenticating with Glance registry. It can either be set to ``noauth`` or ``keystone``. While ``keystone`` is the most commonly used, ``noauth`` is used primarily for testing. It fakes authentication by skipping it. Services which consume this: * ``glance-api`` (mandatory for v1; optional for v2) * ``image scrubber`` (a periodic task) * ``cache prefetcher`` (a periodic task) Possible values: * ``noauth`` * ``keystone`` Related options: * ``use_user_token`` * ``admin_user`` * ``admin_password`` * ``admin_tenant_name`` * ``auth_url`` * ``auth_region`` """)), help=_(""" The region for the authentication service. Services which consume this: * ``glance-api`` (mandatory for v1; optional for v2) * ``image scrubber`` (a periodic task) * ``cache prefetcher`` (a periodic task) Possible values: * A valid string that indicates a region in the catalog. Related options: * ``use_user_token`` * ``admin_user`` * ``admin_password`` * ``admin_tenant_name`` * ``auth_url`` * ``auth_strategy`` """)),
deleted_lines: help=_('Whether to pass through the user token when ' 'making requests to the registry. To prevent ' 'failures with token expiration during big ' 'files upload, it is recommended to set this ' 'parameter to False.' 'If "use_user_token" is not in effect, then ' 'admin credentials can be specified.')), help=_('The administrators user name. ' 'If "use_user_token" is not in effect, then ' 'admin credentials can be specified.')), help=_('The administrators password. ' 'If "use_user_token" is not in effect, then ' 'admin credentials can be specified.')), help=_('The tenant name of the administrative user. ' 'If "use_user_token" is not in effect, then ' 'admin tenant name can be specified.')), help=_('The URL to the keystone service. ' 'If "use_user_token" is not in effect and ' 'using keystone auth, then URL of keystone ' 'can be specified.')), help=_('The strategy to use for authentication. ' 'If "use_user_token" is not in effect, then ' 'auth strategy can be specified.')), help=_('The region for the authentication service. ' 'If "use_user_token" is not in effect and ' 'using keystone auth, then region name can ' 'be specified.')),

commit_message:
Ensure ntpdate is on our test images

We want to be able to set the time in big steps at the beginning of test
runs and one option for doing so is with ntpdate. Ensure ntpdate is
installed on all our images by putting it into the infra package needs
element.

Note that the package name appears to be the same across ubuntu, centos,
and fedora.

Change-Id: Ib3fd4afe5a89d8a799cc15c57254aaf11b6aa3e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/04/358104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ntpdate:

commit_message:
Deprecate all the nova-network functions in the python API

Per the plan, this marks all nova-network-related functions as
deprecated for removal.

Change-Id: I511793cd9a01669e77e1ae5ecb391ce937477309
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/99/348499/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools import warningsdef deprecated(fn): @functools.wraps(fn) def wrapped(*a, **k): warnings.warn('The novaclient.v2.security_group_rules module ' 'is deprecated and will be removed after Nova 15.0.0 is ' 'released. Use python-neutronclient instead.', DeprecationWarning) return fn(*a, **k) return wrapped class SecurityGroupRule(base.Resource): """DEPRECATED""" @deprecated DEPRECATED: Delete this security group rule. """DEPRECATED""" @deprecated DEPRECATED: Create a security group rule @deprecated DEPRECATED: Delete a security group rule
deleted_lines: class SecurityGroupRule(base.Resource): Delete this security group rule. Create a security group rule Delete a security group rule

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 18:33:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/d6c6978e38b438fd87ecf105a1e62ea3eea294cc', 'message': "WIP: Deprecate network-* commands and clamp to microversion 2.35

which is the last version to support the network proxy. We print a
deprecation warning if those commands are used, and mark them as
deprecated in the help text.

This is a network-specific user-friendly bit of sugar to make sure
that nova-network users aren't cut out before we actually drop the
support for it on the server side.

commit_message:
Deprecate network-* commands and clamp to microversion 2.35

This introduces a helper to clamp the client microversion to 2.35,
which is the last version to support the network proxy. We print a
deprecation warning if those commands are used, and mark them as
deprecated in the help text.

This is a network-specific user-friendly bit of sugar to make sure
that nova-network users aren't cut out before we actually drop the
support for it on the server side.

Note that quotas and limits are special because only the network
related resources in those are not returned with 2.36. So this
change handles 2.36 separately for quota-update and
quota-class-update, and deprecates the network resource quota
update arguments for <2.35 as an indication those are going away.

As expected, several of the functional tests have to be updated
to work with the new world that is microversion 2.36.

Related to blueprint deprecate-api-proxies

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Id68c2dbef29b201aa7c8ef9417432feb5596529a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/14/347514/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def cap_at_version(command_name, cs, version): print('WARNING: Command %s is deprecated and will be removed after Nova ' '15.0.0 is released. Use python-neutronclient or openstackclient ' 'instead.' % command_name, file=sys.stderr) want_version = api_versions.APIVersion(version) if cs.api_version > want_version or True: cs.api_version = want_version """DEPRECATED: Print a list of available networks.""" # NOTE(danms): Cap at 2.35 to make sure that we continue to # enable the network commands as long as n-net is supported. cap_at_version('network-list', cs, '2.35') """DEPRECATED: Show details about the given network.""" # NOTE(danms): Cap at 2.35 to make sure that we continue to # enable the network commands as long as n-net is supported. cap_at_version('network-list', cs, '2.35') """DEPRECATED: Delete network by label or id.""" # NOTE(danms): Cap at 2.35 to make sure that we continue to # enable the network commands as long as n-net is supported. cap_at_version('network-delete', cs, '2.35') """DEPRECATED: Disassociate host and/or project from the given network.""" # NOTE(danms): Cap at 2.35 to make sure that we continue to # enable the network commands as long as n-net is supported. cap_at_version('network-disassociate', cs, '2.35') """DEPRECATED: Associate host with network.""" # NOTE(danms): Cap at 2.35 to make sure that we continue to # enable the network commands as long as n-net is supported. cap_at_version('network-associate-host', cs, '2.35') """DEPRECATED: Associate project with network.""" # NOTE(danms): Cap at 2.35 to make sure that we continue to # enable the network commands as long as n-net is supported. cap_at_version('network-associate-project', cs, '2.35') """DEPRECATED: Create a network.""" # NOTE(danms): Cap at 2.35 to make sure that we continue to # enable the network commands as long as n-net is supported. cap_at_version('network-create', cs, '2.35')
deleted_lines: """Print a list of available networks.""" """Show details about the given network.""" """Delete network by label or id.""" """Disassociate host and/or project from the given network.""" """Associate host with network.""" """Associate project with network.""" """Create a network."""

subject: Begin move of UpdateReplace back to its rightful location
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 22:07:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c73874ad75c835b6b7b4a1ded5900fbcfc7103dc', 'message': "Begin move of UpdateReplace back to its rightful location

A deeply misguided effort to move all exceptions out of the
heat.engine.resource module, where they belong, and into the
heat.common.exception module, where they largely do not, broke the API for
third-party resource plugins. Unfortunately this happened a couple of
releases back already, so we can't simply put UpdateReplace back where it
belongs as that would also break the de-facto third-party API.

This change adds an alias in the correct location and a comment indicating
that it will move back at some time in the future. It also switches all of
the in-tree uses back to heat.engine.resource.UpdateReplace, in the hope
that third-party developers will be more inclined to copy from that.

This reverts commit 4e2cfb991ada853023cd0994db2bf9a39126c538.

Change-Id: Iedd5d07d6c0c07e39e51a0fb810665b3e9c61f87
Closes-Bug: #1611104
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 15:03:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c09dcdc24b57774b4696948720e22a6c5c51ad1f', 'message': "Begin move of UpdateReplace back to its rightful location

A deeply misguided effort to move all exceptions out of the

third-party resource plugins. Unfortunately this happened a couple of
releases back already, so we can't simply put UpdateReplace back where it
belongs as that would also break the de-facto third-party API.

This change adds an alias in the correct location and a comment indicating
that it will move back at some time in the future. It also switches all of
the in-tree uses back to heat.engine.resource.UpdateReplace, in the hope
that third-party developers will be more inclined to copy from that.

This reverts commit 4e2cfb991ada853023cd0994db2bf9a39126c538.

Change-Id: Iedd5d07d6c0c07e39e51a0fb810665b3e9c61f87

A deeply misguided effort to move all exceptions out of the
heat.engine.resource module, where they belong, and into the
heat.common.exception module, where they largely do not, broke the API for
third-party resource plugins. Unfortunately this happened a couple of
releases back already, so we can't simply put UpdateReplace back where it
belongs as that would also break the de-facto third-party API.

This change adds an alias in the correct location and a comment indicating
that it will move back at some time in the future. It also switches all of
the in-tree uses back to heat.engine.resource.UpdateReplace, in the hope
that third-party developers will be more inclined to copy from that.

This reverts commit 4e2cfb991ada853023cd0994db2bf9a39126c538.

Change-Id: Iedd5d07d6c0c07e39e51a0fb810665b3e9c61f87
Closes-Bug: #1611104

commit_message:
Begin move of UpdateReplace back to its rightful location

A deeply misguided effort to move all exceptions out of the
heat.engine.resource module, where they belong, and into the
heat.common.exception module, where they largely do not, broke the API for
third-party resource plugins. Unfortunately this happened a couple of
releases back already, so we can't simply put UpdateReplace back where it
belongs as that would also break the de-facto third-party API.

This change adds an alias in the correct location and a comment indicating
that it will move back at some time in the future. It also switches all of
the in-tree uses back to heat.engine.resource.UpdateReplace, in the hope
that third-party developers will be more inclined to copy from that.

This reverts commit 4e2cfb991ada853023cd0994db2bf9a39126c538.

Change-Id: Iedd5d07d6c0c07e39e51a0fb810665b3e9c61f87
Closes-Bug: #1611104
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/17/352617/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Attention developers about to move/delete this: STOP IT!!! UpdateReplace = exception.UpdateReplace raise UpdateReplace(self) raise UpdateReplace(self.name) raise UpdateReplace(self) raise UpdateReplace(self) raise UpdateReplace(self) raise UpdateReplace(self.name) raise UpdateReplace(self) except UpdateReplace: raise UpdateReplace(self) raise UpdateReplace(self) with self._action_recorder(action, UpdateReplace): raise UpdateReplace(self) except UpdateReplace: raise UpdateReplace(self.name)
deleted_lines: raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self.name) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self.name) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) except exception.UpdateReplace: raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) with self._action_recorder(action, exception.UpdateReplace): raise exception.UpdateReplace(self) except exception.UpdateReplace: raise exception.UpdateReplace(self.name)

commit_message:
Get rid of redundant config opts in scrubber

The config opts ``admin_role`` and ``send_identity_headers`` are
already declared in modules ``glance.api.middleware.context`` and
``glance.registry.client.v1.api`` respectively. These opts should
imported here.

Closes-Bug: #1578795

Change-Id: I9ca0aa528f34f3d2157134c7dd59ab3484610901
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/44/313144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.import_opt('admin_role', 'glance.api.middleware.context') CONF.import_opt('send_identity_headers', 'glance.registry.client.v1.api')
deleted_lines: cfg.StrOpt('admin_role', default='admin', help=_('Role used to identify an authenticated user as ' 'administrator.')), cfg.BoolOpt('send_identity_headers', default=False, help=_("Whether to pass through headers containing user " "and tenant information when making requests to " "the registry. This allows the registry to use the " "context middleware without keystonemiddleware's " "auth_token middleware, removing calls to the keystone " "auth service. It is recommended that when using this " "option, secure communication between glance api and " "glance registry is ensured by means other than " "auth_token middleware.")),

commit_message:
Adding NOTE for Kubernetes Secret Generator

This PS adds a not for the process to follow, in order to generate
Kubernetes Secrets which requires for services' bootstrap processes.
Please note this script is only a TEMPORARY solution until final is
found.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0e6314e58de19167ac3761ee1d8b12bea72db44c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/19/356719/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Generating Kubernetes Secrets ============================= Secret for each service must be generated before attempting to bootstrap any services. PS https://review.openstack.org/#/c/354199/ provides a script which can be used to generate or to remove Secrets. This is only a temporary solution which will be replaced in the near future. Before using this script, you MUST generate passwords by using generate_passwords.py. if there is no password.yml, the script will generate and error. Script accepts 1 parameter "create" or "delete". :: # To create Secrets for all services in passwords.yml run: secret-generator.py create # To delete Secrets for all services in passwords.yml run: secret-generator.py delete .. NOTE:: This script is a TEMPORARY solution. Check this doc again soon.

Make 'url' references uppercase for consistency

There are a few places in our documentation where we use lowercase
'url'. This CR changes those to 'URL' for consistency.

commit_message:
Add After=network.target for urandom.service

By making initialize-urandom.service work the same way glean.service
does, we can ensure both services run.  Today, glean will report a
dependency error, which breaks networking on ubuntu-xenial.

Change-Id: Ia7e26166323bd398edd000e70368928e758f22d3
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

some further research.

commit_message:
Task results are now stored in chunks

The entities called Task results are actually task result chunks now.
The main goal of this change is to be able to handle a huge amount of data.

Engine stores a chunk of results every time the next N results are ready. The
last chunk contains information about the total chunk count and SLA check
results.

To handle the huge amount of results from the other side we have to move
all result processing from collection-based approach to iteration-based.

This commit provides support for the following iteration-based processing:
- "detailed" is completely reworked,
- SLA checking is now implemented through stateful checkers.

"Show results" is useless in case of massive data so it just merges all
chunks to one before printing them.

plot2html now also uses the merged chunks and is not ready for huge amount
of results, because it's implementation isn't trivial and requires
some further research.

Change-Id: I9a9393699c6539f9fdb3834fad4873697175e740

commit_message:
Add -n to iptables calls

This change updates the calls that we use in the ocf scripts to
determine if the rules are present to include the -n flag to prevent
unnecessary dns lookups which can lead to deployment failures if dns is
unavailable.

Change-Id: I17d04fbad6def1217429fc3c92bed997fd510eb8
Closes-Bug: #1605540

commit_message:
Add --wait to iptables calls

This change updates the calls that we us in the ocf scripts to determine
if the rules are present to include the -w flag to prevent the scripts
from failing if another iptables call is currently running. It has been
reported that this can occur when the ocf scripts are running in
parallel to the puppet deployment (firewall task)

Change-Id: Ia603f5643720a5fa5407de36ca75830a7c3f57fa
Closes-Bug: #1605540

subject: Cache individual elasticsearch calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 20:34:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/3a098f625044219a8d6d8d737c0bd73ef6fe6260', 'message': "Cache individual elasticsearch calls

When we introduced elastic-recheck querying to openstack-health we
started caching the entire api call whenever es was being queried on
the backend. At the time this made sense because there was a single
api call using elastic search so this was easier. But now that we have
multiple apis using elastic search data we should individually cache
the calls. There are 2 reasons for doing this:

1. We can share the cache of queries across api calls. We only use ES
to run e-r queries on failed runs. Even if looking at fialures from a
different view there will be a lot of overlap in what we're searching
for.

2. With the addition of failure lists that depend on a date range our
cache hit rate goes way down for the api call. That's because our
caching strategy is a bit naive still and doesn't understand ranges so
we always have a cache miss if one of the bounds on the range misses.
To mitigate this by caching ES queries the slow part of the query will
always be cached except for anything new.

Change-Id: Ibf1589e43598dba92e6b6e36f481c38ecc5116ee
"}]
commit_message:
Cache individual elasticsearch calls

When we introduced elastic-recheck querying to openstack-health we
started caching the entire api call whenever es was being queried on
the backend. At the time this made sense because there was a single
api call using elastic search so this was easier. But now that we have
multiple apis using elastic search data we should individually cache
the calls. There are 2 reasons for doing this:

1. We can share the cache of queries across api calls. We only use ES
to run e-r queries on failed runs. Even if looking at fialures from a
different view there will be a lot of overlap in what we're searching
for.

2. With the addition of failure lists that depend on a date range our
cache hit rate goes way down for the api call. That's because our
caching strategy is a bit naive still and doesn't understand ranges so
we always have a cache miss if one of the bounds on the range misses.
To mitigate this by caching ES queries the slow part of the query will
always be cached except for anything new.

Change-Id: Ibf1589e43598dba92e6b6e36f481c38ecc5116ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/62/357462/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refresh keys if caps are changed

Updates the local keyring if any of its param (including caps) are
changed.

Change-Id: I24abbf23cae4f3449c3f1d46df3b3b0a7422c839
Closes-Bug: 1606918
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d823bf6ac91eb1fd12b0acea5161ba83b819f9f7)

commit_message:
Merge branch 'tempest-dataprocessing-client' into import-tempest-dataprocessing-client

Import the Tempest client for data_processing. This is just the initial import
from the Tempest repository; subsequent changes will move it to the proper
place and enable its usage from the tests in this repository.

commit_message:
Correctly reads auth_url

In the *.config script, pkgos_read_admin_creds() was wrongly reading
auth_url, with a -z instead of a -n. This fixes the issue.

Also, the function correctly reads the protocol, and doesn't change it.

Change-Id: I238e2a2dd3de642721e173758773e292ae60d270

subject: Prevent duplicate SG rules in 'concurrent requests' case
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 11:01:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4f065dfbdc53205d6bae3a40320271d16f9d45ed', 'message': "Prevent duplicate SG rules in 'concurrent requests' case

Problem: The process of transaction is too short.
In case of concurrent requests, both requests can pass all tests
and going to write to database. Sometimes the transaction of first
request closed before the transaction of the second request has been
open, because of the above problem. So both of them can access the
latest data (revision number), then passing the StaleDataError and
writing to database successfully.

This patch does extend the process of transaction, then the second
transaction will always open before the first transaction had been
close.

Change-Id: I9ff2bf830c0c9d1114833d33603622f447ee7ca2
Closes-bug: #1532696

commit_message:
Prevent duplicate SG rules in 'concurrent requests' case

Problem: The process of transaction is too short.
In case of concurrent requests, both requests can pass all tests
and going to write to database. Sometimes the transaction of first
request closed before the transaction of the second request has been
open, because of the above problem. So both of them can access the
latest data (revision number), then passing the StaleDataError and
writing to database successfully.

This patch moved the _check_for_duplicate_rules_in_db into transaction
to prevent race condition.

Change-Id: I9ff2bf830c0c9d1114833d33603622f447ee7ca2
Closes-bug: #1532696

commit_message:
Add warning when credential is not specified for each host

User may not set username/password for each host in config
option transport_url. All hosts should have username/password,
or no host have username/password at the same time.
This commit adds warning if user doesn't set properly.

Closes-Bug: #1595965
Change-Id: I4e204ce8365274566064168a2ba02c3278579717

commit_message:
[networking] Reorganize content

Reorganize content as follows:

1) Move topics from "advanced configuration" to "configuration"
   in an attempt to increase adoption of such features by
   decreasing mental barriers.
2) Add missing references to top of files.
3) Add notes for experimental features and/or those with
   incomplete documentation.
4) Fix some consistency issues between titles and file names.
5) Fix some consistency issues with introductory content.
6) Concatenate introductory content, at least temporarily.
7) Remove files lacking content and placeholders to reduce
   the "beta" feel.

Change-Id: Ie667251bcbe77bd1ec59ef5811aed4c499f765e7
backport: mitaka
(cherry picked from commit 059d54002862fcbbec3af705de29c14185a44cdd)

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: Ia0ff77bb2423eeee14a5c7dcd7a2f12ef8c8f957
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-18 21:02:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/commit/5991a8f0e485a06b5175a4dba60a91890caad729', 'message': 'Added SNI support for rabbitmq_server role via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments in the same

commit_message:
Added SNI support for rabbitmq_server role via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments in the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: Ia0ff77bb2423eeee14a5c7dcd7a2f12ef8c8f957

commit_message:
Change hypervisor_type to actual value

Hypervisors API returns a hypervisor_type for each host and the value
can be "QEMU", "xen" or something. The following response is gotten on
the gate test:

  {"hypervisors": [
      {"status": "enabled",
       "service": {
           "host": "ubuntu-xenial-rax-ord-3424979",
           "disabled_reason": null, "id": 8
       },
       "vcpus_used": 0,
       "hypervisor_type": "QEMU",
       "local_gb_used": 0,
       "vcpus": 8,
       ...

Current value "fake" seems meaningless and it is a little difficult
to know actual value of the response.
So this patch changes the value to "QEMU" as an example.

Partially implements blueprint api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: Id1feafae4cd50e3695e641d754b4f02a197bf5f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/99/355099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Build socket list right before select call

This will make sure the socket list and the interface list are
always in sync, and the select call is on the right list of
sockets.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1533892
Change-Id: Id6710f4648203b7d476a2a16ea647224baca1bb9

commit_message:
Added SNI support for os_zaqar role via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: Ibe601b424074cd4d430c9abb303716972c4209e7

commit_message:
Fix iteration in floatingip's add dependencies method

port.Port.FIXED_IPS can be None and we can't iterate by None.

Closes bug: #1608973

Change-Id: I273c6383ab77adfbc5c51b94a2f3b2fa7cdbafc0
(cherry picked from commit 432e24027053b485335f1262aa6d150ee4176faa)

Add install guide

Install Guides are maintained within the project and are linked
to the official docs.

This commit adds the framework and some initial content.

Change-Id: Iff18f0e866d95ff4b8b490511c2acf3209690b69

subject: Introduced metadata for deployment graphs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 11:16:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/73c1c1fdf81f6751f1e4914f48f9ea1ccf097b0d', 'message': 'Introduced metadata for deployment graphs

the following attributes was added:

- node_filter: YAQL expression to select nodes for applying the graph
- node_attributes_on_success: attributes which will be applied to node
       if execution of graph completes successfully.
- node_attributes_on_fail: attributes which will be applied to node
       if execution of graph fails.

commit_message:
Introduced metadata for deployment graphs

the following attributes was added:

- node_filter: YAQL expression to select nodes for applying the graph
- node_attributes_on_success: attributes which will be applied to node
       if execution of graph completes successfully.
- node_attributes_on_fail: attributes which will be applied to node
       if execution of graph fails.
- node_attributes_on_stop: attributes which will be applied to node
      if execution of graph interrupts.

Blueprint: graph-concept-extension
Change-Id: I949b3971f62c17b1d243c8ed97e2802afa4e0cce

added_lines: from nailgun import consts NODE_ATTRIBUTES_SCHEMA = { '$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#', 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'status': {'enum': list(consts.NODE_STATUSES)}, 'pending_addition': {'type': 'boolean'}, 'pending_deletion': {'type': 'boolean'}, 'error_type': {'enum': list(consts.NODE_ERRORS)}} } 'node_filter': {'type': 'string'}, 'node_attributes_on_success': NODE_ATTRIBUTES_SCHEMA, 'node_attributes_on_fail': NODE_ATTRIBUTES_SCHEMA, 'node_attributes_on_stop': NODE_ATTRIBUTES_SCHEMA,

commit_message:
Improve docs for v3 tokens

In preparation to add functional tests for v3 tokens, this
change proposes to detail the method docs, because the tests
need to be based on them.

Change-Id: I5e09a0663c5490fa4dcedeb900c7668a93a8aebd
Partial-Bug: #1330769

commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages for os_neutron

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I714290136850e62256128ee16a54bf88541fbff9

commit_message:
Add vertica new metrics

Added metrics for used license percentage, total amount of
metric definitions and measurements

Change-Id: I75a850e68fd6ec32f03a7645a1b14c2883557ee3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/65/357365/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development LPLICENSE_STATUS_QUERY = "SELECT COALESCE(" \ "(SELECT usage_percent * 100" \ "FROM v_catalog.license_audits " \ "WHERE audited_data ='Total' " \ "ORDER BY audit_start_timestamp " \ "DESC LIMIT 1), 0) license_usage_percent;" MEASUREMENT_COUNT_QUERY = "SELECT COUNT(*) measurement_count" \ "FROM MonMetrics.Measurements;" METRIC_COUNT_QUERY = "SELECT COUNT(*) metric_definition_count" \ "FROM MonMetrics.DefinitionDimensions;" RESOURCE_METRICS_QUERY = "SELECT COALESCE(request_queue_depth, 0) request_queue_depth, " \ "wos_used_bytes, " \ "COALESCE(resource_request_reject_count, 0) resource_rejections, " \ "COALESCE(disk_space_request_reject_count, 0) disk_space_rejections " \ "FROM resource_usage " \ "WHERE node_name = '{0}';" # Database metrics # report license status self._report_int_metric(results[0], dimensions) # report measurement count self._report_int_metric(results[1], dimensions) # report metric count self._report_int_metric(results[2], dimensions) # Node metrics dimensions['node_name'] = node_name self._report_node_status(results[3], dimensions) self._report_resource_metrics(results[4], dimensions) self._report_projection_metrics(results[5], dimensions) self._report_resource_pool_metrics(results[6], dimensions) query += LICENSE_STATUS_QUERY query += MEASUREMENT_COUNT_QUERY query += METRIC_COUNT_QUERY def _report_int_metric(self, results, dimensions): results = self._results_to_dict(results) for metric_name, metric_value in results: self.gauge("vertica." + metric_name, int(metric_value), dimensions=dimensions)
deleted_lines: # (C) Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LPRESOURCE_METRICS_QUERY = "SELECT COALESCE(request_queue_depth, 0) request_queue_depth, " \ "wos_used_bytes, " \ "COALESCE(resource_request_reject_count, 0) resource_rejections, " \ "COALESCE(disk_space_request_reject_count, 0) disk_space_rejections " \ "FROM resource_usage " \ "WHERE node_name = '{0}';" self._report_node_status(results[0], dimensions) self._report_resource_metrics(results[1], dimensions) self._report_projection_metrics(results[2], dimensions) self._report_resource_pool_metrics(results[3], dimensions)

commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages for lxc-host role

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I53fd154fd97a6302a30eaab3903fb7a2132b3fe4

commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages for os_rally

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: Ic3bf4b4238c1c6260d3c8dc0e4800ff26691ae93

located in test_ipmitool.py is now incorrect.

commit_message:
Update ML2 mechanism driver's README

ML2 mechanism driver's README has become out of date.
This patch will update the file and will add new information to it.

Change-Id: Ic118e9e845a625a77272ce5d05a43668246395f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/17/357917/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This mechanism driver is used by ``neutron-server`` in order to bind neutron ports to Hyper-V hosts. In order to use it, ``neutron-server`` must use the Ml2Plugin as a ``core_plugin``. The service's configration file (``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf``), must contain this following line:In order to use this ML2 Mechanism Driver, ``networking-hyperv`` must be installed on the Neutron Controller: :: pip install networking-hyperv Driver, by adding it to the ``mechanism_drivers`` field in ``/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini``:After editing a configuration file, the ``neutron-server`` service must be restarted, in order for the changes to take effect. flat, vlan, gre. Neutron ports on networks having other types than the ones mentioned will not be bound on Hyper-V hosts.
deleted_lines: In order to properly use the Hyper-V Neutron Agent, neutron will have to use the Ml2Plugin. This can be done by setting the ``core_plugin`` field in ``neutron.conf`` to:Driver, by adding it to the ``mechanism_drivers`` field in ``ml2_conf.ini``:flat, VLAN.

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 23:45:07.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv/commit/9536cc9176809c5fdc5999efcee798fb16e65d88', 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I710aa7c85d572478920f41a2574fba5707505129
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I710aa7c85d572478920f41a2574fba5707505129
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/78/353178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PYTHONWARNINGS=default::DeprecationWarning

commit_message:
Fix AgentDeploy take_over() docstring

Fix a misleading docstring in the take_over() method from the AgentDeploy
class. The agent drivers do support booting from network (and deploying
a partition image) since commit 644a1c36b444fadbdda6ae9f0174ed6da385111a.

Change-Id: I9a6038774a69ddfe20b287d2caea569a43fa4149

commit_message:
Update max api version to reflect current maximum

It looks like the MAX_VERSION variable hasn't been updated to
reflect the current max in the cinder server, it's currently
set to 3.7 but the actual max is 3.11. There are currently
calls to 3.9 in cinderclient.v3.shell.

Change-Id: I3b8411b16f8f819b0ff5db03d5cd98cc70cf79ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/36/358036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MAX_VERSION = "3.11"

commit_message:
Disable Sahara by default

Users who want Sahara enable now can simply include the
environments/services/sahara.yaml Heat environment.

commit_message:
Identity v2.0 APIs are deprecated

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/351370/ offically marked
the Identity v2.0 APIs deprecated within keystone, but the follow-on
table of contents that references it was not updated. So one shows
CURRENT and the followed link shows DEPRECATED.

This patch updates the table of contents to properly show DEPRECATED
for the v2.0 APIs.

For comparision, see the current version of this page:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref.html

Change-Id: Ia56829541a27896b588d296889141d5059570320
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/38/352638/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: <link xlink:type="simple" xlink:href="api-ref/identity/v2">Identity API v2.0 (SUPPORTED)</link> <link xlink:type="simple" xlink:href="api-ref/identity/v2-admin">Identity admin API v2.0 (SUPPORTED)</link> <link xlink:type="simple" xlink:href="api-ref/identity/v2-ext">Identity API v2.0 extensions (SUPPORTED)</link>

commit_message:
Do not show empty task attributes in popover

Running deployment task has no end time.
It doesn't make sense to display it.

Implements blueprint ui-deployment-history

Change-Id: I5e476abcb22ebdeac32484a2093ece3e827eac02

))

commit_message:
[zmq] Redis unavailability is not critical

Each time driver couldn't update from Redis
warning message is being logged and work continues
with cached targets state and on existing connections.

Change-Id: I459532f1f60fab1d4c9926e02cdc3c3c6a162047
Closes-Bug: #1610958

commit_message:
Make os_rally inventory group configurable

The default value of "rally_all" remains, but this
allows deployers to target the role to multiple
groups now.

Change-Id: Id1bbda227032f66270fe5656250be7794a1dd4af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_rally refs/changes/15/357515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rally_role_project_group: utility_all # The inventory group where Rally will be installed rally_host_group: rally_all

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-09 02:25:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/8339221322c2a5983208ed6a9f13c039a96cabba', 'message': 'Add some more common DB utils

Some methods from the class have been extracted because they are

Change-Id: I2087c6f5f66154cdaa4d8fa3d86f5e493f1d24d9
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-09 02:36:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/0c2d9daafda47e07c4367c34335be06266660c1c', 'message': "Add some more common DB utils

This adds the common DB utils from common_db_mixin.py that are not
part of the CommonDbMixin class.

Some methods from the class have been extracted because they are
not dependent on the class.

In the code copied from Neutron, all use of 'tenant' has been
replaced with 'project' to comply with the Keystone V3 transition.

Change-Id: I2087c6f5f66154cdaa4d8fa3d86f5e493f1d24d9
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-17 04:36:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/f429a54d9b79c52cace07cfd7ad09492f83384b0', 'message': "Add base DB stuff, step 1

This change 'rehomes' the following base DB modules from neutron:

  neutron/db/common_db_mixin.py  ->  neutron_lib/db/utils.py
  neutron/db/model_base.py       ->  neutron_lib/db/model_base.py

It also adds the following module:

  neutron_lib/db/constants.py

  This module contains constants for the common DB field sizes
  used in the Neutron DB.

1. Rehome common_db_mixin.py contents to db/utils.py

   The code is a copy of the neutron core code, but it is placed
   in db/utils.py because we are planning to refactor away the
   CommonDbMixin class.

   The functions and the class are marked private to prevent
   subprojects from picking up the code before it is refactored.

   The CommonDbMixin.safe_reference() method is not being added to
   neutron-lib since it is not used anywhere.

   Some minor tweaks were made to conform to the stricter hacking
   checks of neutron-lib.

2. Rehome model_base.py to db/model_base.py

   This is a verbatim copy except that the field sizes for
   columns are replaced with the new constants from
   neutron_lib/db/constants.py

   The _HasTenant mixin is marked private since it will be
   replaced by the Keystone V3 compliant HasProject* mixins.

3. Base test classes for DB unit tests

   We add some base classes and fixtures for DB unit tests.

Change-Id: I2087c6f5f66154cdaa4d8fa3d86f5e493f1d24d9
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-17 16:01:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/601bc9291b044c75a5ad2a63514de55024eed697', 'message': "Base DB stuff, step 1: rehome

commit_message:
Base DB: rehome model_base

This change 'rehomes' model_base.py from neutron.

This is not quite a verbatim copy due to the following differences:

 - The field sizes for columns are replaced with the new constants
   from neutron_lib/db/constants.py

 - The tenant_id deprecation message is adjusted slightly.

 - The StandardAttribute table is not included.

We also add some base classes and fixtures for DB unit tests.

Partially Implements: Blueprint neutron-lib

Change-Id: I2087c6f5f66154cdaa4d8fa3d86f5e493f1d24d9

added_lines: import contextlib from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import excutils import six from sqlalchemy.ext import associationproxyfrom neutron_lib._i18n import _, _LE from neutron_lib import exceptions as n_exc LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @contextlib.contextmanager def _noop_context_manager(): yield def safe_creation(context, create_fn, delete_fn, create_bindings, transaction=True): """This function wraps logic of object creation in safe atomic way. In case of exception, object is deleted. More information when this method could be used can be found in developer guide - Effective Neutron: Database interaction section. http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/effective_neutron.html :param context: context :param create_fn: function without arguments that is called to create object and returns this object. :param delete_fn: function that is called to delete an object. It is called with object's id field as an argument. :param create_bindings: function that is called to create bindings for an object. It is called with object's id field as an argument. :param transaction: if true the whole operation will be wrapped in a transaction. if false, no transaction will be used. """ cm = (context.session.begin(subtransactions=True) if transaction else _noop_context_manager()) with cm: obj = create_fn() try: value = create_bindings(obj['id']) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): try: delete_fn(obj['id']) except Exception as e: LOG.error(_LE("Cannot clean up created object %(obj)s. " "Exception: %(exc)s"), {'obj': obj['id'], 'exc': e}) return obj, value def model_query_scope_is_project(context, model): """Check if the scope of a query is a project. Unless a context has 'admin' or 'advanced-service' rights the query will be scoped to a single project_id. :param context: request context :param model: sqlalchemy ORM model class """ return ((not context.is_admin and hasattr(model, 'project_id')) and (not context.is_advsvc and hasattr(model, 'project_id'))) def model_query(context, model): """Return query adjusted for context. :param context: request context :param model: sqlalchemy ORM model class """ query = context.session.query(model) # define basic filter condition for model query query_filter = None if model_query_scope_is_project(context, model): query_filter = (model.project_id == context.project_id) if query_filter is not None: query = query.filter(query_filter) return query # NOTE: This used to be CommonDbMixin._fields() def resource_fields(resource, fields): """Return only the resource items that are in fields. :param resource: a resource dictionary :param fields: a list of fields to select from the resource """ if fields: return {key: item for key, item in resource.items() if key in fields} return resource # NOTE: This used to be CommonDbMixin._filter_non_model_columns() def filter_non_model_columns(data, model): """Return the attributes from data which are model columns. Return a new dict with items from data that whose keys are columns in the model or are association proxies of the model. :param data: a resource dictionary :param model: sqlalchemy ORM model class """ columns = [c.name for c in model.__table__.columns] return dict((k, v) for (k, v) in six.iteritems(data) if k in columns or isinstance(getattr(model, k, None), associationproxy.AssociationProxy))

commit_message:
Updates README.rst

Adds "How to Install" section.
Adds "Tests" section.
Adds "How to contribute" section.
Adds the list of OpenStack projects os-win is currently used in.

Change-Id: I08c42791a5c8f4d1c758e2da85ed2641e7b36151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/63/357863/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============This library contains Windows / Hyper-V specific code commonly used in OpenStack projects. The library can be used in any other OpenStack projects where it is needed. How to Install -------------- os-win is released on Pypi, meaning that it can be installed and upgraded via pip. To install os-win, run the following command: :: pip install os-win To upgrade os-win, run the following command: :: pip install -U os-win Note that the first OpenStack release to use os-win is Mitaka. Previous releases do not benefit from this library. Tests ----- You will have to install the test dependencies first to be able to run the tests. :: C:\os_win> pip install -r requirements.txt C:\os_win> pip install -r test-requirements.txt You can run the unit tests with the following command. :: C:\os_win> nosetests os_win\tests How to contribute ----------------- To contribute to this project, please go through the following steps. 1. Clone the project and keep your working tree updated. 2. Make modifications on your working tree. 3. Run unit tests. 4. If the tests pass, commit your code. 5. Submit your code via ``git review``. 6. Check that Jenkins and the Microsoft Hyper-V CI pass on your patch. 7. If there are issues with your commit, ammend, and submit it again via ``git review``. 8. Wait for the patch to be reviewed. os-win is currently used in the following OpenStack projects: * nova * cinder * compute-hyperv * networking-hyperv * ceilometer * os-brick

subject: Don't alarm users with "skipping postconfig" messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 09:13:35.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/constants.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/390ab1d9b41902f933e3c5b108c521a1c2a988a5', 'message': 'Don't alarm users with "skipping postconfig" messages

On each overcloud deploy we printed a message like:

    Skipping "horizon" postconfig because it wasn't found in the
    endpoint map output

and in trunk with composable services we now print even more of
these. Such messages are slightly confusing because it looks like
something went wrong when in fact everything's fine. The fix is twofold:

1) Only print the "skipping postconfig" messages in debug mode.

2) Remove Horizon from the services list. It's not customary to create a
   service entry and endpoints in Keystone for Horizon (after all it's
   not an API). We only used to create that endpoint because it was a
   requirement of Tuskar UI.

Change-Id: I1ac30419104cd66312cd9aec7cc1ace867d1df4b
Closes-Bug: #1614115
'}]
commit_message:
Don't alarm users with "skipping postconfig" messages

On each overcloud deploy we printed a message like:

    Skipping "horizon" postconfig because it wasn't found in the
    endpoint map output

and in trunk with composable services we now print even more of
these. Such messages are slightly confusing because it looks like
something went wrong when in fact everything's fine. The fix is twofold:

1) Only print the "skipping postconfig" messages in debug mode.

2) Remove Horizon from the services list. It's not customary to create a
   service entry and endpoints in Keystone for Horizon (after all it's
   not an API). We only used to create that endpoint because it was a
   requirement of Tuskar UI.

Change-Id: I1ac30419104cd66312cd9aec7cc1ace867d1df4b
Closes-Bug: #1614115

commit_message:
Add SNI support to rsyslog_server role via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: I16075a6749f228d75d5d5b337449576ed0f8a00f

commit_message:
Reset AccountReaper stats in __init__

Make the AccountReaper __init__ method reset its stats variables.
This saves the unit test having to initialise the stats variables.
Also add more asserts to some AccountReaper test cases.

Change-Id: Iea112962d89ebfa3450f43b2a28ac8e8ed8b07b0

deleted_lines: r.stats_return_codes = {} r.stats_containers_deleted = 0 r.stats_containers_remaining = 0 r.stats_containers_possibly_remaining = 0 r.stats_objects_deleted = 0 r.stats_objects_remaining = 0 r.stats_objects_possibly_remaining = 0

commit_message:
placement: add filtering by attrs to resource_providers

Make it possible to GET /resource_providers passing filters as query
params to get only a subset of resource providers.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

Change-Id: I2c905d55ac20fd1c5a285b1e460cdd31dff8c7dd

commit_message:
Remove references of s3 store driver

As we are removing the s3 driver from source tree per change
I032b0fc16400cbd2112687d38e010128be699221 , it seems right to remove the
references of the same in the glance tree.

Updated here are files that referenced s3; these files include:

    * documentation files
    * documentation of the glance architecture (source and png files)
    * config help text
    * stores associated with location strategy
    * tests

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I680ee2baf39b49156d173e2ae108ae5d0221eca7
Depends-On: I032b0fc16400cbd2112687d38e010128be699221
Depends-On: I5d2da0611365b838f41285b64cdcfef9adf50e85

Nova currently does not have a quota categorization for tracking storage
consumption, which encourages users to disproportionately consume storage

instead of using Cinder volumes, where quota is tracked. This blueprint

commit_message:
Nova disk quota tracking

Nova currently does not have a quota categorization for tracking storage
consumption, which encourages users to disproportionately consume storage
resources through Nova (image-booted instances, LVM-backed instances, etc.)
instead of using Cinder volumes, where quota is tracked. This blueprint
proposes the addition of a new quota category to track these non-Cinder
usages of disk space.

Change-Id: I3cff3c512e62983a43826d99b5132329e946ef54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/28/311828/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Nova disk quota tracking ======================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-disk-quota-tracking Nova currently does not have a quota categorization for tracking storage consumption, which encourages users to disproportionately consume storage resources through Nova (image-booted instances, LVM-backed instances, etc.) instead of using Cinder volumes, where quota is tracked. This blueprint proposes the addition of a new quota category to track these non-Cinder usages of disk space. Problem description =================== Nova does not currently classify storage consumed via itself underneath any quota category, in effect giving users no-cost storage. While the amount of storage consumed via this method can be gated with other quota classes (i.e., eventually a user will run out of CPU/memory quota), the appearance of the storage being free seems to have a psychological effect on users that encourages them to disproportionately consume these resources instead of using Cinder volumes, even if their Cinder quotas are high enough that they would exhaust other quotas before hitting their Cinder limitations. In order to counteract such behavior, this blueprint proposes that storage allocated purely via Nova be tracked, managed and displayed via existing quota mechanisms. Use Cases --------- * provide accurate tracking of non-Cinder storage consumption for reporting * provide a quota class to limit users from dogpiling non-Cinder storage Proposed change =============== * Add a nova_storage quota class that accounts for space consumed by root volumes of image-booted instances * ephemeral storage * swap storage * Set nova_storage to -1 by default so that backwards compatibility is maintained with existing behavior. * Update Nova quota management as needed to verify that adequate space exists in this quota before launching an instance. * Update Nova scheduler as needed, if needed (I do not think any scheduler changes will be required, as the scheduler is already aware of local hypervisor resources). Alternatives ------------ None known at present. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- novaclient and openstackclient will need to be updated to recognize the new quota class as a valid class type, but this should not impact the REST APIs, which are already capable of consuming arbitrary classes. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Some people might get mad when they don't get lots of disk space for free any more. Performance Impact ------------------ Instance launches will add additional quota checks as needed, which may slow instance launch very slightly. However, since all the data should be gathered in the same database transaction as the existing quota checks, I would not anticipate this adding more than a few milliseconds to instance launch, if that. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: erhudy Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Write the nova support for this functionality. * Add testing support to devstack / tempest. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add unit tests that consider the new quota class and verify that it has the expected effects. Documentation Impact ==================== The admin guide will need to be extended to explain this functionality. References ========== This work was prompted by discussion with other operators who face similar challenges in managing non-Cinder storage usage: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2016-February/009607.html History ======= None

commit_message:
WIP: Add a script for counting Tempest bugs

As QA team, the bug count of Tempest and the other projects are
important and this script outputs a simple file of the count to
run daily or weekly.

Change-Id: Ic330d20fec233e602861a8bda55e33e51f742e2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/74/355674/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash PAGE=0 while true do wget "http://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bugs?orderby=-importance&memo=$PAGE&start=$PAGE" -O log.$PAGE END=`grep "There are currently no open bugs." log.$PAGE | wc -l` if [ $END = "1" ]; then break fi PAGE=`expr $PAGE + 75` done for STATUS in "NEW" "INCOMPLETE" "CONFIRMED" "TRIAGED" "INPROGRESS" "FIXCOMMITTED" do COUNT=`grep "status status$STATUS" log.* | wc -l` echo "$STATUS, $COUNT" done

commit_message:
[DOC] Add clarifying statement on CPU type

This changes adds a minor clarifying statement about what services can
run on ppc64le. This statement will be removed upon integration of
MariaDB 10.1 into the OSA code base. Other options to support ppc64le at
the management side are being evaluated.

Change-Id: If94eb580c14d5bb64c9314deb3aec37f9b900f98

commit_message:
Remove passing of password while installing plugin for upgrade

Fuel CLI uses different argument for username in 7.0 and 8.0+ releases.
Now password in astute.yaml is updating during master node setup so
it's possible to remove login and password from the command.

Change-Id: Ida21eff98216600e65f219770af474a3bd6680c3

commit_message:
[DOCS] Update gate job names

The gate job names have changed. This updates the developer docs
to reflect the new names and provide a basic description to include
the Multi-OS changes too.

Change-Id: Id704eebf86fb60e31c0ad2ae60872a5cd70391c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/51/357851/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * ``gate-openstack-ansible-docs-ubuntu-xenial``: This job executes the* ``gate-openstack-ansible-linters-ubuntu-xenial``: This job executes the `Lint Tests`_. * ``gate-openstack-ansible-openstack-ansible-aio-ubuntu-trusty``: where ``aio`` is the scenario, ``ubuntu`` is the distribution, and ``trusty`` is the version of the distribution. The same test is executed against multiple distribution versions, and may be executed against multiple distributions and multiple scenarios too. This job executes the ``gate-check-commit.sh`` script which executes a convergence test and then a functional test. The convergence test is the execution of an AIO build which aims to test the primary code path for a functional environment. The functional test then executes OpenStack's Tempest testing suite to verify that the environment that has deployed successfully actually works.
deleted_lines: * ``gate-openstack-ansible-docs``: This job executes the* ``gate-openstack-ansible-linters``: This job executes the `Lint Tests`_. * ``gate-openstack-ansible-dsvm-commit``: This job executes the ``gate-check-commit.sh`` script which executes a convergence test and then a functional test. The convergence test is the execution of an AIO build which aims to test the primary code path for a functional environment. The functional test then executes OpenStack's Tempest testing suite to verify that the environment that has deployed successfully actually works.
